Section.Name: Normal/Abnormal
Section.Acronym: WHNOR ECG within normal limits for age and sex

Section.Name: Ventricular Hypertrophy
Section.Acronym: VCLVH voltage criteria (QRS) for left ventricular hypertrophy
VCRVH voltage criteria (QRS) for right ventricular hypertrophy

Section.Name: Conduction disturbances
Section.Acronym: CLBBB complete left bundle branch block
ILBBB incomplete left bundle branch block
ALBBB atypical left bundle branch block
CRBBB complete right bundle branch block
IRBBB incomplete right bundle branch block
IVCD> minor intraventricular conduction disturbance (QRS>120 ms)
BIFAS bifascicular block (its two components shall always be listed separately)

Section.Name: Other QRS morphology or general descriptive statements
Section.Acronym: COPD ECG consistent with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
POORR poor R-wave progression in precordial leads
PROMR prominent R waves in right precordial leads
LVOLT low QRS voltages in the frontal and horizontal leads
LVOLF low voltage in frontal leads
LVOLH low QRS voltages in the horizontal leads
HVOLF high QRS voltages in the frontal leads
HVOLH high QRS voltage in the horizontal leads
S1S23 S1 S2 S3 type QRS pattern
RSR1 rSr type in V1 or V2
TRNZL transition zone in precordial leads displaced to the left
TRNZR transition zone in precordial leads displaced to the right

SubSection.Name: Statements related to impulse formation (abnormalities)
SubSection.Acronym: TACHO tachycardia, origin unknown or not specified
BRADO bradycardia, origin unknown or not specified
TORSA torsade des pointes ventricular tachycardia
MTACH multifocal tachycardia (multiform), supraventr. or ventricular

SubSection.Name: Sinus node dysfunction, atrial and AV-conduction defects
SubSection.Acronym: I2AVB intermittent second degree AV block
A2AVB alternating second degree AV block
MOBI2 Mobitz type 2 second degree AV block
SARA sinus arrest with atrial escape
SARSV sinus arrest with supraventricular escape
SARJ sinus arrest with junctional escape
SARV sinus arrest with ventricular escape

SubSection.Name: Statements related to ectopic rhythm abnormalities
SubSection.Acronym: RVPCS or RPVCS run of ventricular premature complexes
RAPCS run of atrial premature complexes
RJPCS run of junctional premature complexes
ABPCS aberrant premature complexes, origin unknown
ABSVC aberrant complex, possibly supraventricular origin
ABSVS aberrant complexes, possibly supraventricular origin
ABASH aberrant supraventricular complexes of the Ashman type
PVPCS or PPVCS paired ventricular premature complexes
BIGU bigeminal pattern (unknown origin, SV or Ventricular)
TRIGU trigeminal pattern (unknown origin, SV or Ventricular)

SubSection.Name: Statements related to (predominant) conduction and block
SubSection.Acronym: BLOCK unspecified delay or failure of impulse propagation
AECHO return of impulse to its chamber of origin: the atrium
VECHO return of impulse to its chamber of origin: the ventricle

SubSection.Name: Pacemaker types and pacemaker function
SubSection.Acronym: PACEA artificial pacemaker rhythm with 100 % capture
PACEP artificial pacemaker rhythm with partial capture
PACEF artificial pacemaker rhythm with underlying atrial fib or flutter
EPAVS electronic pacemaker AV sequential, normal capture
EPFC electronic pacemaker, failure to capture
EPFS electronic pacemaker, failure to sense
EPARV bipolar electronic pacemaker at the apex of the right ventricle
EPURV unipolar electronic pacemaker at the apex of the right ventricle
PAVA electronic ventricular pacing with atrial sensing
PADEM demand pacing, analysis based upon intrinsic complexes

SubSection.Name: International classification of pacemaker types
SubSection.Acronym: PAAAI V: ventricle; A: atrium; D: both
PAVDD V, A, D: same as above; O: no sensing
PADVI - 5th byte = the response of the pacemaker to a sensed beat:
D: double (atrial triggered + ventricular inhibited or atrial triggered/inhibited + ventric. inhibited)

SubSection.Name: Other rhythm related statements
SubSection.Acronym: RATE rate, not specified ventricular or atrial (but mostly ventricular)

Section.Name: Descriptive axis statements
Section.Acronym: LAD left axis deviation of QRS in frontal plane (< -30)
RAD right axis deviation of QRS in frontal plane (> +90)
AXL leftward axis (i.e. not severe enough to be called LAD)
AXR rightward axis (i.e. not severe enough to be called RAD)
AXVER axis vertical in frontal plane
AXHOR horizontal axis in frontal plane
TRSLT transition in horizontal leads shifted leftward
TRSRT transition in horizontal leads shifted rightward

SubSection.Name: Ischemic ST-T changes
SubSection.Acronym: ISCAN ischemic ST-T changes in anterior leads
ISCAL ischemic ST-T changes in anterolateral leads
ISCIN ischemic ST-T changes in inferior leads
ISCAS ischemic ST-T changes in anteroseptal leads
ISCLA ischemic ST-T changes in lateral leads
ISCPO ischemic ST-T changes in posterior region
ISCIP ischemic ST-T changes in inferoposterior region
ISCIL ischemic ST-T changes in inferolateral leads
ISCAF ischemic ST-T changes in antero-inferior leads

SubSection.Name: Ischemic ST-T changes compatible with subendocardial injury
SubSection.Acronym: INJAN ischemic ST-T changes compatible with subendocardial injury in anterior leads
INJAL ischemic ST-T changes compatible with subendocardial injury in anterolateral leads
INJIN ischemic ST-T changes compatible with subendocardial injury in inferior leads
INJAS ischemic ST-T changes compatible with subendocardial injury in anteroseptal leads
INJLA ischemic ST-T changes compatible with subendocardial injury in lateral leads
INJPO ischemic ST-T changes compatible with subendocardial injury in posterior region
INJIP ischemic ST-T changes compatible with subendocardial injury in inferoposterior region
INJIL ischemic ST-T changes compatible with subendocardial injury in inferolateral leads
INJAF ischemic ST-T changes compatible with subendocardial injury in antero-inferior leads

SubSection.Name: ST-T changes compatible with subepicardial injury
SubSection.Acronym: EPIAN ST-T changes compatible with subepicardial injury in anterior leads
EPIAL ST-T changes compatible with subepicardial injury in anterolateral leads
EPIIN ST-T changes compatible with subepicardial injury in inferior leads
EPIAS ST-T changes compatible with subepicardial injury in anteroseptal leads
EPILA ST-T changes compatible with subepicardial injury in lateral leads
EPIPO ST-T changes compatible with subepicardial injury in posterior region
EPIIP ST-T changes compatible with subepicardial injury in inferoposterior region
EPIIL ST-T changes compatible with subepicardial injury in inferolateral leads
EPIAF ST-T changes compatible with subepicardial injury in antero-inferior leads

SubSection.Name: ST-T changes
SubSection.Acronym: STTAN ST-T changes in anterior leads
STTAL ST-T changes in anterolateral leads
STTIN ST-T changes in inferior leads
STTAS ST-T changes in anteroseptal leads
STTLA ST-T changes in lateral leads
STTPO ST-T changes in posterior region
STTIP ST-T changes in inferoposterior region
STTIL ST-T changes in inferolateral leads
STTAF ST-T changes in antero-inferior leads

SubSection.Name: Non-specific ST-T changes
SubSection.Acronym: NSTAN non-specific ST-T changes in anterior leads
NSTAL non-specific ST-T changes in anterolateral leads
NSTIN non-specific ST-T changes in inferior leads
NSTAS non-specific ST-T changes in anteroseptal leads
NSTLA non-specific ST-T changes in lateral leads
NSTPO non-specific ST-T changes in posterior region
NSTIL non-specific ST-T changes in inferolateral leads
NSTAF non-specific ST-T changes in antero-inferior leads

SubSection.Name: Non-specific ST elevation
SubSection.Acronym: STEAN non-specific ST elevation in anterior leads
STEAL non-specific ST elevation in anterolateral leads
STEIN non-specific ST elevation in inferior leads
STEAS non-specific ST elevation in anteroseptal leads
STELA non-specific ST elevation in lateral leads
STEPO non-specific ST elevation in posterior region
STEIL non-specific ST elevation in inferolateral leads
STEAF non-specific ST elevation in antero-inferior leads

SubSection.Name: Non-specific ST depression
SubSection.Acronym: STDAN non-specific ST depression in anterior leads
STDAL non-specific ST depression in anterolateral leads
STDIN non-specific ST depression in inferior leads
STDAS non-specific ST depression in anteroseptal leads
STDLA non-specific ST depression in lateral leads
STDPO non-specific ST depression in posterior region
STDIL non-specific ST depression in inferolateral leads
STDAF non-specific ST depression in antero-inferior leads

SubSection.Name: Reciprocal ST-T changes
SubSection.Acronym: RSTAN reciprocal ST-T changes in anterior leads
RSTAL reciprocal ST-T changes in anterolateral leads
RSTIN reciprocal ST-T changes in inferior leads
RSTAS reciprocal ST-T changes in anteroseptal leads
RSTLA reciprocal ST-T changes in lateral leads
RSTPO reciprocal ST-T changes in posterior region
RSTIL reciprocal ST-T changes in inferolateral leads
RSTAF reciprocal ST-T changes in antero-inferior leads

SubSection.Name: T-wave abnormality
SubSection.Acronym: TABAN T-wave abnormality in anterior leads
TABAL T-wave abnormality in anterolateral leads
TABIN T-wave abnormality in inferior leads
TABAS T-wave abnormality in anteroseptal leads
TABLA T-wave abnormality in lateral leads
TABPO T-wave abnormality in posterior region
TABIL T-wave abnormality in inferolateral leads
TABAF T-wave abnormality in antero-inferior leads

SubSection.Name: Non-specific T-wave changes
SubSection.Acronym: NTAN non-specific T-wave changes in anterior leads
NTAL non-specific T-wave changes in anterolateral leads
NTIN non-specific T-wave changes in inferior leads
NTAS non-specific T-wave changes in anteroseptal leads
NTLA non-specific T-wave changes in lateral leads
NTPO non-specific T-wave changes in posterior region
NTIL non-specific T-wave changes in inferolateral leads
NTAF non-specific T-wave changes in antero-inferior leads

SubSection.Name: Other ST-T descriptive statements
SubSection.Acronym: QUIN ST-T changes due to quinidine-effect
PERIC ST-T changes compatible with pericarditis
STVAG ST-elevation V1-V3 possibly due to enhanced vagal tone
REPOL ST-T changes compatible with early repolarization
ANEUR ST-T changes compatible with ventricular aneurysm
METAB possibly due to metabolic changes
CONG secondary to congenital heart disease
VALV secondary to valvular heart disease
MYOIN suggests myocardial infarction (no location specified)
ISDIG compatible with ischemia / digitalis effect
STPAC review ST-T analysis for the effects of pacing

Section.Name: Statements related to pediatric ECG analysis
Section.Acronym: ASD changes compatible with atrial septal defect (ostium secundum)
ECD compatible endocardial cushion defect (ASD ostium primum)
ACA compatible with anomalous location of the coronary artery

Section.Name: Statements related to the ECG calibration
Section.Acronym: HSCAL all leads half standard calibration (i.e. 5 mm/mV)
HSPRE precordial leads half standard calibration
HSLIM limb leads half standard calibration
DSCAL all leads double standard calibration (i.e. 20 mm/mV)
DSPRE precordial leads double standard calibration
DSLIM limb leads double standard calibration

Section.Name: Technical problems
Section.Acronym: QCERR poor data quality, interpretation may be adversely affected
SIMUL input is from simulator or test pattern
PINFO inconsistent or erroneous patient demographic data
INCAN incomplete or no analysis (by the program)
